webTitle: James Earl Ray arrested - pictures from the past

fields.standfirst: On 8 June 1968, James Earl Ray, an escaped American convict, was arrested in London and was charged with the murder of Martin Luther King Jr, the leader of the African-American Civil Rights Movement.   In April 1967, Ray had escaped from Missouri State Penitentiary where he had been serving a 20 year sentence for armed robbery.  Martin Luther King was shot dead on 4 April 1968 in Memphis and Ray was soon identified as the chief suspect.  Ray was traced to London where he had been staying in an Earls Court hotel
fields.headline: James Earl Ray arrested - pictures from the past

webTitle: Conflict in the Middle East is about more than just religion

fields.standfirst:
Recently, Shia-Sunni conflicts have seen Hezbollah help Syrian government forces to recapture Qusair. Battles rage between the two sides in Lebanon while in Iraq the monthly death toll from Sunni-Shia violence has topped 1,000. But religion alone does not explain the escalating tensions. Fundamental political shifts begun by the Arab spring are helping create new regional disputes in the Middle East

Click here for a pdf depicting key Sunni and Shia populations

But a new exhibition at Tate Britain, curated by two unlikely champions of Lowry, reconsiders the painter's place in history and suggests that his mills and smoking chimneys are more than portraits of a bygone world

Lowry and the Painting of Modern Life – in pictures
fields.trailText: Though the public love LS Lowry, his standing in the art world has been in decline. Now a new exhibition reconsiders the painter's place in history, writes Rachel Cooke
fields.headline: LS Lowry: the people's artist comes in from the cold
